title: Personal Assistant Job at Elvaridah Limited
content:
Elvaridah Limited - Our client in the interior decor industry is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Personal Assistant

Job Location: Lekki Pahse 1, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time (Hybrid)
Reports To: CEO

Job Summary


	We are seeking an experienced and highly organized Personal Assistant to provide administrative support to our executive.
	The ideal candidate will have excellent communication skills, be proactive, and able to maintain confidentiality.


Key Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Manage the executive's calendar, schedule appointments, and make travel arrangements
	Prepare correspondence, reports, and presentations
	Handle incoming calls, emails, and messages
	Maintain files, databases, and records
	Coordinate meetings, events, and conferences
	Provide general administrative support
	Build and maintain relationships with colleagues, clients, and stakeholders.

N120,000 - N150,000 monthly

title: Accountant Job at Bisrotex Investment Synergy Limited
content:
We are a registered, solution focused comapnay leveraging technology to deliver quality, accessible, affordable, and reliable financial service (micro-credit) to financially excluded and vulnerable in Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant

Job Location: Ikorodu, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	We are seeking a detail-oriented Accountant to manage our financial records, ensure compliance with accounting standards, and provide financial insights to support business decisions.


Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Prepare and review financial statements, including balance sheets, income statements, and cash flow statements.
	Manage accounts payable, accounts receivable, and general ledger.
	Ensure compliance with accounting standards, laws, and regulatory requirements.
	Analyze financial data, identify trends, and provide recommendations.
	Prepare and file tax returns, and ensure timely payment of taxes.
	Develop and implement financial policies and procedures.
	Collaborate with management to prepare budgets and forecasts.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess a B.Sc with 2+ years of work experience. 


Skills:


	Strong knowledge of accounting principles, laws, and regulations.
	Proficiency in excel.
	Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
	Ability to work accurately and efficiently under deadlines.


Salary
N70,000 - N100,000 monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: bisrotexinvestmentsynergy@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Executive Assistant Job at Wendernek Consulting Limited
content:
Wendernek Consulting Limited - Our client is a Lagos-based business group with active interests in the interior design eco system.

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Executive Assistant

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	The focus is on execution, growth, and building efficient systems across our different ventures.
	The client is in need of a reliable and organized Executive Assistant to support the Creative Director with both business operations and personal responsibilities.


Key Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Manage the Creative Director’s calendar, inbox, and task follow-ups.
	Coordinate meetings, travel, personal errands, and family logistics.
	Run occasional personnel-related errands and handle basic team coordination.
	Track project timelines and deliverables across all business areas.
	Handle communication with vendors, clients, team members, and service providers.
	Prepare basic reports, research summaries, and presentations.
	Monitor expenses, receipts, and liaise with accountants.
	Keep files, task lists, and business systems up to date and organized.


Requirements


	A BA / B.Sc Degree.
	1 – 2 years of experience in a similar role.
	Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
	Works with initiative and follows through without handholding.
	Excellent written and verbal communication.
	Proficiency in Google Workspace, WhatsApp Business, and project management tools (e.g. Trello, Project co, Asana).
	High emotional intelligence and professionalism.
	Ability to manage multiple tasks across both business and personal duties.


What We Offer


	Salary: N170,000 per month (non negotiable).
	HMO / Health insurance after probation.
	Paid annual leave.
	In-office work 3 days a week (Lekki, Lagos).
	Severance package after one year of continuous service.
	Opportunity for growth and professional development.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume / CV to: recruitment@wendernek.com using the Job Position as the subject of email.

title: QSHE Officer Job at Olman Business Solutions (OBS) Limited
content:
Olman Busines Solution - Our client is a leading hospitality and catering company with an internationally recognized brand, providing services to corporations and individuals with integrity, courtsey, customer focus, creativity and the highest degree of professionalism.

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: QSHE Officer

Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
Effective Management:
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Communicates information on the QHSE Management System throughout the organisation and promotes HSE awareness through various communication channels this to be done by induction, training, campaigns, quizzes etc
	Prepare QHSE documentation for clients/projects as per the requirements and assisting in compilation of QHSE aspect of bids in consultation with the BD / Operations team.
	Undertake QHSE inspections internally and with third parties (contractors) as per the approved inspection program of the company by actively participating in internal audit. Follows up on the preventive and / or corrective actions identified during the inspections and monitors the timely closing of the actions in coordination with other departments.
	Perform daily walk throughs in HCUE facilities and / or in HCUE clients’ premises to monitor and promote a safe workplace by using prepared checklist and report all non-conformance.
	Inspection of incoming raw / central store equipment (Eleme).


Training and Development:


	Actively participates in monthly HSE meeting for all employees.


Relationship Management:


	Implements and encourages the behavioral based safety culture in the organization through safe job observations.


Status Reporting:


	Record QHSE key performance indicators on a monthly basis and issue reports as necessary. Suggest and advise changes to ensure continuous improvement on any additional effective KPIs to be added in the system as part of continual improvement.
	Actively participate in the HSE incident investigations and prepare required reports in consultation with management.
	Compile statistics and write reports to QHSE Manager.


Monitoring:


	Ensure that PPE’s is provided and used by staff.
	Identify potential hazards and ways of reducing risk.


Qualifications & Experience


	HND / B.Sc Degree in Engineering, Food Science Tech or Environmental Sciences
	At least 5 years of working with international HSE standards, codes and practices including Nigerian HSE experience
	Membership of relevant HSE professional bodies


Competencies Required:
Organizational Competencies:


	Leadership
	Oral & Written Communication skills
	Organizational Awareness
	Customer Orientation.


Functional Competencies:


	Excellent business acumen Good knowledge of Food safety.
	General knowledge of Health safety and environment in catering industry.
	Ability to adapt to changes in the work environment.
	Excellent interpersonal and conflict handling skills.
	Communicate accurately, correctly, timely, effectively and in an appropriate manner using email, documentation and verbally.
	Excellent report writing skills with attention to detail, correctness and accuracy with good use of English and technical terminology.


Corporate Culture:


	Job Ownership
	Integrity
	Team work
	Can-do Spirit
	Passion for Excellence
	Resourcefulness
	Tact and Diplomacy.


Salary
N200,000 - N250,000 monthly. 

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Cover Letter and Resume explaining their interest and suitability for the role to: careers@olmanbsl.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note


	Olman Business Solutions is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion.
	We encourage qualified individuals from all backgrounds to apply.

title: Compliance Manager Job at Management Sciences for Health (MSH)
content:
The Management Sciences for Health (MSH), a global health nonprofit organization, uses proven approaches developed over 40 years to help leaders, health managers, and communities in developing nations build stronger health systems for greater health impact. We work to save lives by closing the gap between knowledge and action in public health.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Compliance Manager
Job ID: R4834
Job Location: Abuja

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Compliance Manager will conduct verification of MSH internal controls and compliance of all financial and operational functions within MSH Nigeria.  
	The position holder will verify that all staff are well versed in donor and MSH policies and procedures and are adhering to such standards. 
	S/he will identify gaps in existing internal control systems and provide recommendations to strengthen them; will identify gaps in staff’s knowledge and skills in MSH Policies & SoPs; will provide recommendations for training; and may provide training directly to staff.


Responsibilities


	Ensure that all MSH Nigeria financial and operational activities are in compliance with Nigeria law (tax laws, CSA laws and government pension agency laws), donor rules and regulations, and MSH policies and standards.
	Develop an annual customized compliance monitoring plan, including evaluation tools, standards, ethical considerations, and schedule to evaluate all project or remote staff/office locations, and to revisit sites needing extra attention.
	Develops compliance framework for the MSH including compliance checklists for the various business processes, transaction classes, country laws governing NGO operations, and specific donor requirements.
	Periodically reviews and updates the compliance monitoring checklist and other tools to stay current with MSH procedures and policies.
	Examines the effectiveness of internal controls and compliance within MSH Nigeria policy framework and identifies gaps in procedures and controls systems and provides recommendations to the Country Leadership Team for strengthening them.
	Follows-up on recommendations to ensure they have been implemented and adhered to.
	Tests internal controls, targeting high risk areas, including workshops, vehicle usage, inventory control and cash advance management, payroll and Fleet Management.
	Documents internal control weaknesses and compliance deviations and their impact and makes recommendations to address these weaknesses.
	Identifies gaps in knowledge and skills and provides recommendations for training.
	May be requested to provide training directly to staff.
	Prepares detailed reports of each compliance review and other task assignments, with prioritized findings and recommendations.
	Presents final reports to the MSH Nigeria Country Leadership Team after review and approval from Supervisor.
	Provides risk assessment for financial and operational landscape. Identify high risk, high probability events, and provide recommended mitigation plan.   Provide ad hoc risk assessments for specific scenarios by request.
	Provide ad-hoc advice, helping staff to achieve the goal of establishing sound risk management and internal control systems; offer practical advice on how best to comply with financial policy and donor guidelines.
	When necessary, collaborates with internal and external audit on investigations of whistleblower cases, suspected fraud, mismanagement, loss of assets, etc.
	Follows-up on recommendations from the internal and external auditors to ensure the recommendations have been implemented and adhered to.
	Stays abreast of laws, directives, and current trends in the local legal and NGO environment. 
	Prepares quarterly audit, investigations, and status of audit recommendations reports for submission to Director Internal Audit and Nigeria Country Representative, if applicable.
	Meets with Project Director on a regular basis, or as requested by the CR.
	Perform other duties as assigned.


Qualifications


	Postgraduate ’s degree in accounting or business management or related area.


Preferred:


	Advanced degree preferred
	Professional certification in Accounting, Internal Audit, and Fraud Examination
	Seven plus years of experience in compliance, risk management or audit required.
	Extensive familiarity of donor grant/contracts rules and regulations.
	Experience in international development programs preferred.
	Excellent planning, management, and organizational skills.
	Proven leadership and interpersonal skill.
	Professional proficiency in English required


Core Job Competencies:
Navigating the Environment:


	Perspective, Dealing with ambiguity, Organizational Agility, Political Savvy and Strategic Agility


Ensuring Delivery of Results:


	Functional/Technical skills, Client Focus, managing through systems, Managing and Measuring work, Negotiating, Information Sharing, Process Management, Priority Setting, Problem Solving and Timely Decision Making


Core Personal Competencies:


	Ethics and Values, Integrity and Trust, Listening, Written Communication.
